intro: Rytigynia macrura, commonly known as the large-fruited rytigynia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rytigyniaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often red or orange in color. It is typically found in moist, tropical or subtropical environments, often in lowland rainforests. Rytigynia macrura is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
